file_content.text: I knew the Empire would send someone if I put on a big show. I wanted you to see what I've become.
Your people were asking me questions. There was so much pain, and then--! Power, raw power. I killed them all.
All I'd ever wanted was to be an analyst for the Republic. I never killed before. I didn't realize it could feel so good.
You'd make a good Sith.
I knew a Sith would understand.
For an analyst, you kill well.
It was so natural. My pain and fear became rage.
You still have to die.
You don't understand. I wasn't really trying to kill you.
I'm sorry for your pain.
Don't pity me. The pain and killing set me free.
Everything I've ever kept bottled up inside because there was nothing I could do about it... it's become pure power.
I thought, after I killed the interrogator, that I'd become a monster. I realize now... I'm not a monster. I'm a god.
Precisely.
Precisely.
Whoa, calm down.
That's a joke, right?
The Imperial interrogators I killed aren't laughing.
I can still kill you.
The point is, we don't have to fight.
I've finally realized my true potential. I want to go to Korriban and train as a Sith.
Get going, then.
Get going, then.
Thank you. I will remember you, when I reach my true power.
You're too stupid. [Kill him]
No--wait!
